channel.title: VPSland
channel.description:
How do i use vpsland? Im not sure which one i should buy, or how i can make it host my private server.
I need to know: 1) which one to buy. 2) how do i make it host my server. 3) how can i change my source while its on. 4) can i still control files on my server to promote/demote players.

item.title: VPSland
item.dc:creator: @zane01 zane01
item.description:
@zane01 wrote:

Yes, im just doing the 18$ one become i need to test it properly. If all goes well i may buy a higher one to support more players. But my computer has some decent ram, but of course i need more lol. So your probly right.

Read full topic

item.title: VPSland
item.dc:creator: @silabgarza silabgarza
item.description:
@silabgarza wrote:

zane, yah

but how much ram do u have on ur computer?

bcuz the $18 isn’t that great…
chances are your computer might be aroudn the $34

Read full topic

item.title: VPSland
item.dc:creator: @zane01 zane01
item.description:
@zane01 wrote:

When i click on “Windows EZ” it brings me to another page, then i click 18$ monthly. Then it took me to a page asking for a domain. [i dont think i have one?]

Im not really sure i get how to use vpsland well, so do i put my server ip in domain spot?

Read full topic

item.title: VPSland
item.dc:creator: @silabgarza silabgarza
item.description:
@silabgarza wrote:

  1. you need to choose that for urself, i run a famous server, so i use the $68
  2. you upload ur source to a uploading place like… rapidshare/mediafire/uppit then download the files u uploaded on ur VPS
  3. if u use windows XP, there is a program mandatory on it, remote desktop conection, thats how u get on your VPS
  4. yes, u login thru RDC (remot… etc) and open that file, its like looking at a computer screen far away and having control over it, thru ur computer

Read full topic

item.title: VPSland
item.dc:creator: @webber webber
item.description:
@webber wrote:

Do not use VPSLand, they are currently an overcrowded vps distributer due to the mass demand they are not limiting the amount they sell therefore the lag on each VPS is getting worse. I hear MgHoster is good, I know the owner of that website as well so it is definitely reliable.

Read full topic
